p.s: The author uses a few communicative strategysstrategies to convince us of his opinion.
For example the structure, the text has four paragraphs in which he tells different things.
In the first paragraph, he describes the problem of not speaking englishEnglish.
After that, he gives an example of a place where they can notcannot speak englishEnglish and shows how hard the life of the people there is.
In the third paragraph, he tells the reader his own experiences with learning englishEnglish.
With that, he wants the reader to be more interested in the text and in learning englishEnglish.
He also wants the reader to understand the problem more with having a real story he can understand.
In the first three paragraphs he wants to show the reader the problems and in the fourth paragraph he tells his idea of a solution.
In his text he also uses some stylistic devices to strengthstrengthen his statements.
From line 18 to 19 he says But you don't learn to stand on your own two feet if someone is holding you up.
With that metaphermetaphor, he wants to say that you have to do some things by your own and in this case you should learn englishEnglish so you won't need someone to translate for you.
He also uses the example of Bangladeshis (ll. 7-10) in which he shows how important it is to learn englishEnglish and he wants to give the reader the goal not to end like them.
Another communicative strategy he uses is the repititionrepetition of we and us (cf. l. 3, l. 4, l. 18, l. 20, l. 23).
With that he wants the reader to feel like he is concerned of the story.
To sum up, the author wants as many people as possible to learn to speak englishEnglish, so they can get employment and communicate with others.
